p: The octahedral ion [AlH 6] 3− that is present in the so-called intermediaries of alanates also shows infrared and Raman active modes. From the 15 normal vibration modes of a group with octahedral symmetry, two modes are active in the infrared, and three modes are active in the Raman [ 321]. In Figure 30, we present a correlation between the stretching IR most intense peak of M 3AlH 6 (M = group 1, [AlH 6] 3− octahedra) versus the effective ionic radii [ 307]. The available data for the so-called intermediaries of alanates of group 1 (M 3AlH 6) are scarcer than for the tetrahedral alanates, i.e., MAlH 4. Thus, the correlation was constructed with data of Li, Na, and K [ 167, 307, 318, 322, 323, 324, 325, 326, 327]. The red dots of Rb 3AlH 6 and Cs 3AlH 6 are an extrapolation based on the fitted curve.
